Package sort

Class Numbers

java.lang.Object
sort.Numbers
public class Numbers
extends java.lang.Object
Since:
2020-09-22
Version:
1.3 This class contains all the methods required for generating an array of a given length with random integer values. The user may search for the number of occurrences of a given number, n, using binary search.
Author:
Neil Kingdom

    • generateNumbers

      public void generateNumbers()
      Since:

    • findIndex

      public int findIndex​(int key)
      Returns:
      Returns the index at which key was found, else -1 This method uses linear search to find the key
      Since:
      2020-09-22

    • findCount

      public int findCount​(int key)
      Parameters:
      key - The value which the user requests to be searched.
      Returns:
      Returns the number of occurrences of the value of key within the array. This function searches for the number of occurrences of key and returns that number using linear search.
      Since:
      2020-09-22

    • iterativeBinarySearch

      public int iterativeBinarySearch​(int key)
      Parameters:
      key - The value which the user requests to be searched.
      Returns:
      Returns the number of occurrences of the value of key within the array. This function searches for the number of occurrences of key and returns that number using iterative binary search.
      Since:
      2020-09-29

    • recursiveBinarySearch

      public int recursiveBinarySearch​(int key, int low, int high, int iterations, java.lang.String s)
      Parameters:
      key - The value which the user requests to be searched.
      low - The starting search point.
      high - The ending search point.
      iterations - The number of passes it took to find the key.
      s - Formatted String which prints the halves of each pass.
      Returns:
      Returns the number of occurrences of the value of key within the array. This function searches for the number of occurrences of key and returns that number using recursive binary search.
      Since:
      2020-09-29

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      Returns a string of the concatenated values and indexes in the array. This method prints out the values in the randomly generated array as well as their respective indexes.
      Since:
      2020-09-22

    • isArrayCreated

      public int isArrayCreated()
      Returns:
      Returns exit status (-1 if false, 0 if true). This method simply returns 0 if the array has been initialized, or -1 if not.
      Since:
      2020-09-22

    • isEmpty

      public int isEmpty()
      Returns:
      Returns exit status (-1 if false, 0 if true). This method returns 0 if the array contains data, otherwise it returns -1.
      Since:
      2020-09-22
